subject: p14969719
History: Metastatic breast cancer, history of effusions requiring pleurodesis, patient with PleurX catheter without significant drainage.
Findings: One portable upright AP view of the chest. A moderate right pleural effusion with fluid layering along the lateral right lung and apex as well as medially adjacent to the mediastinum is unchanged. Mild right lower lobe atelectasis is unchanged. The cardiac, mediastinal and hilar contours are stable. Calcified lymph node in the aortopulmonary window is unchanged. The left lung is clear. No left pleural effusion.
Impression: No significant change in moderate right pleural effusion.
